page.title: 13Garway Traffic Survey
page.content: For two weeks we recorded details of all the cars that passed the school between 9 a.m. and 3 p.m. We noted the cars' direction, driver, colour, make and registration letter. During that time about 10 per cent more cars went down the road (towards Hereford) than up it. Male drivers outnumbered females in a ratio of 5:3. On average about 15 cars per hour passed the school. Mondays and Tuesdays were slightly busier than other days, perhaps because they are playgroup days and the playgroup is just down the road. The most common registration letter was Y, followed by X, V, T, W and B. This was an unusual traffic survey, as we often knew who was driving and where they were going.
